dojg.description: The contracted form of と言っても or としても.
dojg.meaning: Even if (someone says that); even if someone tries to; although

examples.japanese: (ksa).一人でしよう(っ)たって、それは無理だ。
examples.english: You'll never be able to do it alone! (literally: Even if you try to do it alone, that's impossible.)

examples.japanese: (ksb).今すぐ買いに行く(っ)たって、もう店はみんな閉まっている。
examples.english: Even if you wanted to go buy it right now, the stores are all already closed.

examples.japanese: (ksc).高い(っ)たって、１００万円はしないだろう。
examples.english: Even though it's said to be expensive, my guess is it won't cost more than one million yen.

examples.japanese: (ksd).日本語教育の経験者(だ)ったって、彼女はまだ日本以外で教えたことはない。
examples.english: Although she has experience teaching Japanese, she hasn't yet taught anywhere outside of Japan.

examples.japanese: (a).あの家は君が買おうったって買えるようなものじゃない。
examples.english: That house is not something you could buy even if you wanted to.

examples.japanese: (b).僕を騙そうったってそうはいかない。
examples.english: It won't work if you try to cheat me.

examples.japanese: (c).彼が何を言おうったってそれをとめようとは思わない。
examples.english: Whatever he may want to say, I don't think I'll stop it.

examples.japanese: (d).今から帰るったってもう電車はないよ。
examples.english: There are no more trains even if (you say) you want to go home  now.

examples.japanese: (e).調べるったって、こんなたくさんある資料を一人で調べるのは無理だ。
examples.english: Even if you say you'll look through the materials, it's  impossible for you to do it alone because there are so many.

examples.japanese: (f).近いったってとても歩いて行ける距離じゃない。
examples.english: Although (I say) it's close, it's not a distance you can walk  at all.

examples.japanese: (g).いくら簡単ったって、やっぱり最低限のパソコン知識がなくては使えない。
examples.english: No matter how simple (they say) it is, in fact you won't be  able to use it without a minimum knowledge of computers.

examples.japanese: (h).「断食」ったって、全く何も口に入れないんじゃない。1日に2回、野菜ジュースを飲むことはできる。
examples.english: Although I say "fasting," it's not like you can't put anything  in your mouth. You can drink vegetable juice twice a day.
